executor_display_name: Check if Profiles Are in a List
executor_description: Checks if one or more emails, phone numbers, or push tokens are in a given list. No distinction is made between a person not being in a given list, and not being present in Klaviyo at all. Can check up to a maximum of 100 emails at a time.

Adds profiles to a list. This endpoint is functionally equivalent to adding profiles to a list via a CSV upload and will immediately add profiles to the list. If you would like to subscribe profiles to a list and use the double opt-in settings for the list, please use the subscribe endpoint.
Removes profiles from a list.

executor_display_name: Check if Profiles Are in a List and not Suppressed
executor_description: Checks if one or more emails are in a given list and not suppressed. No distinction is made between a person not being in a given list, and not being present in Klaviyo at all. Can check up to a maximum of 100 emails at a time.
Gets all of the emails, phone numbers, and push tokens for profiles in a given list or segment

queryParams.description: A marker value returned by a previous GET call. Use this to grab the next batch of records.

executor_description: Marks a person as excluded from all email. This works the same way as manually excluding someone via the excluded people page. Someone who is excluded will no longer receive any campaigns or flow emails.

Returns global exclusions/unsubscribes. Global exclusions are distinct from list exclusions in that these email addresses will not receive any emails from any list. Typically, when someone unsubscribes from a campaign, they are only unsubscribed from that list and are not globally unsubscribed.

queryParams.description: Filter results based on the reason for someone being excluded. The possible values are unsubscribed, bounced, invalid_email, reported_spam and manually_excluded. Only a single value may be specified at a time. Defaults to return all profiles regardless of reason.
Sort order to apply to results, either ascending or descending. Valid values are asc or desc. Defaults to asc.
For pagination, the number of results to return. Default = 500
For pagination, which page of results to return. Default = 0

executor_description: Creates a new list.
Updates a list's name.

executor_display_name: Check if Profiles Are in a Segment
executor_description: Checks if one or more emails, phone numbers, or push tokens are in a given segment. No distinction is made between a person not being in a given segment, and not being present in Klaviyo at all. Can check up to a maximum of 100 emails at a time.
Unsubscribes and removes profiles from a list.
Returns a listing of all of the lists in an account.

Subscribes profiles to a list. Profiles will be single or double opted into the specified list in accordance with that list’s settings. Note: If you have double opt-in enabled (default behavior), users will not be added to list until they opt-in, and so API will respond with an empty list: []
Returns information about a list.
Deletes a list from an account. This is a destructive operation and cannot be undone. It will also remove flow triggers associated with the list.

executor_display_name: Get All Exclusions for a List
executor_description: Gets all of the emails and phone numbers that have been excluded from a list along with the exclusion reasons and exclusion time. This endpoint uses batching to return the records, so for a large list multiple calls will need to be made to get all of the records.

queryParams.description: A marker value returned by a previous GET call. Use this to grab the next batch of records.

executor_description: Request a deletion for the profiles corresponding to an email address, phone number, or person identifier (profile ID).  All profiles that match the provided identifier will be deleted.  The arguments should be sent as content type application/json.  Note that only one identifier (email, phone_number, or person_id) can be specified.  In addition to your Private API key, you need to set exactly one of the following parameters: email, phone_number, or person_id.

queryParams.description: A marker value returned by a previous GET call. Use this to grab the next batch of records.

executor_description: Cancels a campaign send. Marks a campaign as cancelled regardless of it's current status.

mockResponses.description: The Campaign object with summary information including updated details.

executor_description: Returns summary information for the campaign specified.

mockResponses.description: The Campaign object with summary information.

executor_description: Creates a new campaign. The created campaign is a draft and is not automatically sent.

value.description: The list you will send the campaign to.

The template that will define the content of the page. Note: the Email Template is copied when creating this campaign, so future changes to that Email Template will not alter the content of this campaign.
The email address your email will be sent from and will be used in the reply-to header.
The name or label associated with the email address you're sending from.
The email subject of the campaign
If not specified, this will default to the subject of the campaign.
If set, limits the number of emails sent to an individual within a short period. Valid values are true and false. If not specified, defaults to true.
If specified, adds Google Analytics tracking tags to links. Valid values are true and false. If not specified, defaults to false.

mockResponses.description: The newly created Campaign object with summary information.

executor_description: Updates details of a campaign. You can update a campaign's name, subject, from email address, from name, template or list.

value.description: The list you will send the campaign to.

The ID of the Email Template object that will be the content of this campaign. Note the Email Template is copied when creating this campaign, so future changes to that Email Template will not alter the content of this campaign.
The email address your email will be sent from and will be used in the reply-to header.
The name or label associated with the email address you're sending from.
The email subject of the campaign
A name for this campaign. If not specified, this will default to the subject of the campaign.
If set, limits the number of emails sent to an individual within a short period. Campaigns initially default to true.
If specified, adds Google Analytics tracking tags to links. Campaigns initially default to false.

mockResponses.description: The Campaign object with summary information including updated details.

executor_description: Creates a copy of a campaign. The new campaign starts as a draft.

value.description: The name for the new campaign. All other properties of the campaign will remain the same. Note, the template for the new campaign will be cloned from the existing template so changes to the existing campaign's content will not alter the content of the new campaign.
The list you will send the campaign to.

mockResponses.description: The new Campaign object with summary information including updated details.

executor_description: Returns summary information about email recipients for the campaign specified that includes each recipients email, customer ID, and status.

queryParams.description: For pagination, the number of results to return. Max = 25,000
Sort order to apply to results, either ascending or descending. Valid values are asc or desc. Defaults to asc.
For pagination, if a response to this endpoint includes a next_offset, use that value to get the next page of recipients.

mockResponses.description: A list of dictionaries with keys status, email, customer_id and variation_id for each email recipient.

executor_description: Returns a list of all the campaigns you've created. The campaigns are returned in reverse sorted order by the time they were created.

queryParams.description: For pagination, which page of results to return. Default = 0
For pagination, the number of results to return. Max = 100

executor_description: Schedules a campaign for a time in the future

value.description: A timestamp of the format %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S in the UTC timezone.  Ex:  2022-01-13 00:00:00

mockResponses.description: A JSON object with a single key status which should be queued.

executor_description: Queues a campaign for immediate delivery

mockResponses.description: A JSON object with a single key status which should be queued.

executor_display_name: Get Events for a Specific Metric
executor_description: Returns a batched timeline for one specific metric.

queryParams.description: Either a 10-digit Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a pagination token obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. For backwards compatibility, UUIDs will continue to be supported for a limited time. Defaults to current time.
Number of events to return in a batch. Default = 50, Max = 100
Sort order to apply to timeline, either descending or ascending. Valid values are desc or asc. Defaults to desc. Always descending when since is not sent, as since defaults to current time.

executor_description: Exports event data from Klaviyo, optionally filtering and segmenting on available event properties. Note that the only comparison operator currently supported is =. To ensure a correct response, enter parameters in the curl request as they are ordered below:

queryParams.description: Beginning of timeframe to pull event data for. The default value is 1 month ago. Can also accept a 10-digit UNIX timestamp. When sending a start_date, you must also send an end_date  Ex: 1610524800 OR 2021-01-13

End of timeframe to pull event data for. The default is the current day, or 1 month from start_date, whichever is sooner. Can also accept a 10-digit UNIX timestamp. When sending an end_date, you must also send a start_date. Must be at most 31 days after start_date  Ex: 1612080000 OR 2021-01-31
Granularity to bucket data points into - one of day, week, or month. Defaults to day.
Type of metric to fetch - one of unique, count, value, or sum. Defaults to count. For sum a property name to operate on must be supplied as a JSON-encoded list like ["sum","ItemCount"]

Optional, JSON-encoded list. Conditions to use to filter the set of events. A max of 1 condition can be given. where and by parameters cannot be specified at the same time.  ex: [["$attributed_flow","=","FLOW_ID"]]
The name of a property to segment the event data on. where and by parameters cannot be specified at the same time. Cannot be used alongside where parameter.
Maximum number of segments to return. Default = 25, MAX = 1000

executor_description: Returns a list of all the metrics in your account.

queryParams.description: For pagination, which page of results to return. Default = 0
For pagination, the number of results to return. Default = 50 ; Max = 100

executor_description: Returns a batched timeline of all events in your account.

queryParams.description: Either a 10-digit Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a pagination token obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. For backwards compatibility, UUIDs will continue to be supported for a limited time. Defaults to current time.
Number of events to return in a batch. Default = 50, Max = 100
Sort order to apply to timeline, either descending or ascending. Valid values are desc or asc. Defaults to desc. Always descending when since is not sent, as since defaults to current time.

executor_display_name: Get Profile's Events for a Specific Metric
executor_description: Returns a person's batched timeline for one specific event type.

queryParams.description: Either a 10-digit Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a pagination token obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. For backwards compatibility, UUIDs will continue to be supported for a limited time. Defaults to current time.
Number of events to return in a batch. Default = 50, Max = 100
Sort order to apply to timeline, either descending or ascending. Valid values are desc or asc. Defaults to desc. Always descending when since is not sent, as since defaults to current time.

executor_description: NOTE: If you are interested in creating or updating profiles in Klaviyo, you should be using the Identify API instead. The best use-case for this route is changing a profiles's email address or other primary identifier after a profile already exists in Klaviyo.  Add or update one more more attributes for a Person, based on the Klaviyo Person ID. If a property already exists, it will be updated. If a property is not set for that record, it will be created.  You can update any attribute, by sending one or more attributes along their new values, as query parameters. Recommended attributes for this endpoint: $email, $phone_number, $id
Get a profile's Klaviyo ID given exactly one corresponding identifier: email, phone_number, or external_id. NOTE: calling this endpoint with multiple identifiers will result in an error.

Klaviyo's web tracking uses an encrypted identifier. However, there are many use cases that require developers to have access to a given profile's email or phone number. In such cases, developers can use this operation to exchange an encrypted identifier for a profile ID, which they can then use to retrieve the full profile data (by making a subsequent request to the get-profiles operation).

executor_display_name: Get Profile's Events for all Metrics
executor_description: Returns a batched timeline of all events for a person.

queryParams.description: Either a 10-digit Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a pagination token obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. For backwards compatibility, UUIDs will continue to be supported for a limited time. Defaults to current time.
Number of events to return in a batch. Default = 50, Max = 100
Sort order to apply to timeline, either descending or ascending. Valid values are desc or asc. Defaults to desc. Always descending when since is not sent, as since defaults to current time.

executor_description: Retrieves all the data attributes for a person, based on the Klaviyo Person ID.
Creates a copy of a given template with a new name.

value.description: The new name of the email template.

mockResponses.description: The newly created Email Template object with summary information.

executor_description: Updates the name and/or HTML content of a template. Only updates imported HTML templates; does not currently update drag & drop templates.

value.description: The new name of the email template.
The new HTML content for this template.

mockResponses.description: The updated Email Template object with summary information.

executor_description: Renders the specified template with the provided data and send the contents in an email via the service specified. This API is intended to test templates only, and is rate limited to the following thresholds: 100/hour, 1,000/day.

value.description: Mixed. string, or JSON encoded array of objects with "email" and "name" keys. abraham.lincoln@klaviyo.com OR [{"name":"Abraham Lincoln","email":"abraham.lincoln@klaviyo.com"}]

Optional, JSON object. This is the context your email template will be rendered with. Email templates are rendered with contexts in a similar manner to how Django templates are rendered. This means that nested template variables can be referenced via dot notation and template variables without corresponding context values are treated as falsy and output nothing. ex: { "name" : "George Washington", "state" : "VA" }

mockResponses.description: The Email Template object with an additional data property that contains the status of the message. If successful, the status will be queued.

data.text: This is an email for george.washington@klaviyo.com

executor_description: Renders the specified template with the provided data and return HTML and text versions of the email.

value.description: This is the context your email template will be rendered with. Email templates are rendered with contexts in a similar manner to how Django templates are rendered. This means that nested template variables can be referenced via dot notation and template variables without corresponding context values are treated as falsy and output nothing.

mockResponses.description: The Email Template object with an additional data property that contains both the HTML and text versions of the rendered template.

data.text: This is an email for george.washington@klaviyo.com

mockResponses.description: Returns a list of all the email templates you've created. The templates are returned in sorted order by name.

executor_description: This endpoint is used to track a profile's activity. The following data is encoded in a JSON object. NOTE: an account can have up to 200 unique metrics (event types). This endpoint can accept payloads up to approximately 1MB.

This endpoint is also used to track a profile's activity. It takes as input the same payload as the above POST request, but as a base64-encoded string passed as a query parameter. NOTE: This is offered for backwards compatibility; we recommend all new implementations use the POST approach above.

queryParams.description: String representation of base64 encoded JSON object

executor_description: This endpoint is used to track and update properties about an individual without tracking an associated event. The following data is stored in a JSON object.

queryParams.description: String representation of base64 encoded JSON object
